entries.english: Class 4 (Kĩ-/Gĩ- → Ci-/Ĩ-): Gĩkombe gĩkĩ kĩnene (this big cup) → Ĩkombe ĩcĩ nene (these big cups). Diminutive (Ka-/Ga- → tũ-): Gakombe gaka kega (this nice small cup) → tũkombe tũtũ twega (these nice small cups)

examples.kikuyu: Gĩtarũrũ gĩkĩ kĩnene → Ĩtarũrũ ĩcĩ nene
examples.english: This big woven tray → These big woven trays

examples.kikuyu: Gatarũrũ gaka karĩĩ → tũtarũrũ tũtũ twarĩĩ
examples.english: This wide small woven tray → These wide small woven trays

entries.english: G: Guka gucia guoko gakwa (Grandfather, pull my hand), Gĩra gĩkombe gĩkĩ (Come for this cup). H: Haha hena heho (This place is cold), Huha mwaki wahota (Blow the fire if you can). K: Kairĩtu kena karamu (The girl has a pen), Kana kona kora kora (The child saw a frog and ran away)
Na (and/nor), No (but), Kana (or), Thutha wa (after), Ona gũtũĩka (although), Tondũ wa/niamu (because), Kinya rĩrĩa (till)

examples.english: They neither eat pork nor do they drink beer
examples.notes: Na used for 'nor' in negative context
